msItem.rubric: Name of St. Mary; name of the commissioner; a few lines, or groups of lines, alternating with black lines, on the incipit (or incipit page) of the texts; the numbers and title of the miracles in Text I-2; the initial words of some subsections; the word haleluya on fol. 163vb; Ethiopic numerals and sometimes their elements; elements of punctuation signs and of coronis; crux ansata with coronis on fol. 182r.

list.item: The structure of quires cannot be determined due to the poor condition of the Ms.

supportDesc.condition: The front board is broken and the back is missing; the original sewing is for the most part missing. The Ms. has been wrongly rearranged and resewn. Many fols. are missing and some are misplaced. Many fols. are affected by humidity and stained with dirt; some parts of text are illegible (e.g., fols. 177rb, 177ra, 267va, 268rb). The bottom part of fols. 242-268 seems damaged by rodents. Fol. 1 is damaged. Cuts repaired, e.g., on fols. 67, 149, 174, 221. Some fols. seem to have been cut at the bottom: e.g., fols. 123, 128, 133, 134.

layout.ab: the number of the lines is very irregular
The upper line is written below the ruling (above on many fols., e.g. 1-59, 65, 74-81, 107-112, 115r-119r, 201-208).
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
One or two upper ruled lines were not used by the scribe on fols. 98r, 114r, 227r, 234v, 235r.

handDesc.handNote: on fol. 182r, the crux ansata with coronis marking the beginning; on fols. 23r, 57v, 120r, 139v, the coronis used as caesura

decoDesc.decoNote: Fol. 2r (incipit page of Text I-1): elaborate, coloured (red, blue, yellow, white), ornamental frame, with an horizontal band reaching the top of the page, and three vertical extensions reaching a second horizontal band at the bottom of the page; interlaces.

Fols. 13v, 23v, 32r, 36r, 50r, 54r, 58r, 72v, 82v, 89v, 91v, 98v, 113v, 114va, 127v, 133vb, 140ra, 150vb, 168r, 176v, 188r, 197r, 202r, 223r, 229r, 258r, 262v (incipit or incipit pages of Texts I-2, I-3, I-4, I-5, I-7, I-8, I-9, I-11, I-12, I-13, I-10, I-14, I-16 I-17, I-19, I-20, I-21, I-22, I-23, I-24, I-26, I-27; I-28, I-29, I-30, I-35, I-32): coloured (red, green, blue, yellow, white), ornamental band, with three vertical extensions reaching the middle of the page; the horizontal band reaches the top of the page; interlaces, crosses.

Fol. 42r (incipit page of Text I-6): elaborate, coloured (red, green, yellow, white), ornamental band with three vertical extensions reaching the bottom of the page; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page; interlaces, crosses, geometric motifs.
Fols. 121ra, 182rb, 236rb, 263vb, 270r (incipits or incipit page of Texts I-18, I-25, I-31, I-33, I-36): simple, coloured (red, blue, yellow, white) ornamental band; interlaces.

list.item: - The note ገድለ፡ ሰማዕታት፡ ብርእየ፡ ሥመሪ፡ is written in the bottom margin of fol. 51r, probably in a secondary hand. - The title ገድለ፡ ሰማዕ[sic] is written, in a secondary hand, at the edge of the bottom margin on fol. 73r. - Fol. 120vb: crude and recent note, after Text I-17, repeating the incipit of Text I-18 on fol. 121ra. - Cues for the rubricator (numerals) throughout the Ms. - Corrections (words or letters) written interlineally: fols. 58rb, 60va, 74ra, 135va. - Correction written over erasure: fol. 38ra. - Compressed script: fols. 35vb, 41va, 53vb, 89rb, 113rb, 263va. - Pen trial: fol. 222v. - Crude notes and drawings in pen or pencil in the margins and on the inner front board: e.g., fols. 12r, 18r, 31r, 32r, 57r, 75r, 137r, 143r, 202r.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards (the front bord is broken; the back is missing) Two pairs of sewing stations.

Some of the quires are reinforced by parchment guards. On the front board possibly traces of leather cover. Recent threads for the sewing are visible on some fols. (e.g., between fols. 55v-56r and on fols. 122v, 123v, 125v, 144v).

origin.origDate: If we suppose that the Ms. was commissioned by ʾabunä Ṗeṭros from Däbrä Bizän (s. above), the date of its production may be collocated in the second half of the 15th century.

person.persName: ʾAbunä Ṗeṭros is mentioned as the commissioner in the subscriptio at the end of Text I-36 and in the exhortations at the end of the most texts. In many of them, his name is mentioned together with the name of his monastery (i.e. ʾabunä Ṗeṭros zä-Däbrä <…>), which is however always partly erased. On fol. 13rb (Text I-1) the last letter of the name is readable(ደብረ፡ <…>ን). On fols. 228vb, 254ra, 262rb, it is said that he is the son (disciple) of ʾabunä Filǝṗos, named the “righteous” (“ṣadǝq”, fol. 254rb) and the “teacher” (“räban”, fols. 262rb, 270va). Considering this date and the small clue on fol. 13rb, it might be possible suppose that the monastery of ʾabunä Ṗeṭros and where this Ms. was originated is Däbrä Bizän (in Eritrea). The founder of this monastery was the monk Filǝṗos (1322/23-1406; cp. EAE II, 15-17). On fol. 57vb, ʾabunä Ṗeṭros is mentioned as the abbot (ʾabä mǝnet) of his monastery. According to an additional note in a Bible Ms. from Däbrä Bizän, Ṗeṭros is mentioned as the 4th “mämhǝr” of the monastery, third successor of the founder Filǝṗos. His death is to be collocated between 1488/89 and 1491/92. His predecessor was Säräqä Bǝrhan (d. 1460/61 or 1457/58) (cp. Schneider, in AÉ 1978, 138-39).
